meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of clods.
meanings.sent1: The farmer's boots were cloddier after working in the muddy field.
meanings.sent2: The path became cloddier after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The dog's fur was cloddier than usual after rolling in the dirt.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a cloddier appearance with its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent5: The garden looked even cloddier with the patches of dried mud.

meanings.definition: Lacking grace or refinement; awkward or unpolished.
meanings.sent1: Her cloddier dance moves stood out among the graceful performers.
meanings.sent2: The cloddier handwriting was difficult to read.
meanings.sent3: His cloddier attempts at painting always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The cloddier speech by the nervous student was endearing.
meanings.sent5: The cloddier manners of the guest made everyone uncomfortable.
